perturbation.original_text:
2.7 In case NeuroBo requests Dong-A to conduct any additional activities, including testing (e.g. AMV, PV), documentation (e.g. CMC
packaging), which NeuroBo requires for obtaining the NDA for the Licensed Product in the Territory, the Parties shall, in good faith, negotiate the
terms and conditions, including, without limitation, the costs and expenses for conducting such additional testing activities of the Licensed
Products and/or their matching placebo. For any such activities, NeuroBo shall pay to Dong-A [***] ([***]%) of the fees as agreed by the Parties
within [***] days prior to conducting such activities by Dong-A, and shall pay the balance due within [***] days after delivery by Dong-A to
NeuroBo of the deliverables as agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.7 In case NeuroBo requests Dong-A to conduct any additional activities, including testing (e.g. AMV, PV), documentation (e.g. CMC
packaging), which NeuroBo requires for obtaining the NDA for the Licensed Product in the Territory, the Parties shall, in good faith, negotiate the
terms and conditions, including, without limitation, the costs and expenses for conducting such additional testing activities of the Licensed
Products and/or their matching placebo. For any such activities, NeuroBo shall pay to Dong-A [***] ([***]%) of the fees as agreed by the Parties
within [***] days prior to conducting such activities by Dong-A, and shall pay the balance due within [***] days after delivery by Dong-A to
NeuroBo of the deliverables as agreed by the Parties. However, if the total cost of the additional activities exceeds $[***], the final payment is due 90 days after delivery.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict in payment deadlines. The original clause states the balance is due within [***] days after delivery. The addition states that if the total cost exceeds $[***], the final payment is due 90 days after delivery. This creates uncertainty as to which deadline applies for high-cost activities.

perturbation.original_text:
4.3 Upon agreement by the Parties of the Firm Order, Dong-A shall issue to NeuroBo an invoice in Korean Won for each shipment of the
Licensed Products and/or their matching placebo based on the Firm Order. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by Dong-A, NeuroBo shall pay the
invoiced supply price (i) in Korean Won (KRW) or (ii) in United States Dollars (USD) which amount shall correspond the invoiced amount
converted from KRW to USD at the exchange rate of the payment date, no later than [***] days prior to the shipment date by way of wire transfer
to Dong-A. NeuroBo shall be responsible for and pay all wire transfer fees incurred in the Territory. If Dong-A does not receive payment of any
sum due to it on or before the due date, [***] interest shall thereafter accrue on the sum due to until the date of payment at the [***] rate of [***]
percent ([***]%) over the then-current prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York, New York or the maximum rate allowable by New York law,
whichever is lower.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.3 Upon agreement by the Parties of the Firm Order, Dong-A shall issue to NeuroBo an invoice in Korean Won for each shipment of the
Licensed Products and/or their matching placebo based on the Firm Order. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by Dong-A, NeuroBo shall pay the
invoiced supply price (i) in Korean Won (KRW) or (ii) in United States Dollars (USD) which amount shall correspond the invoiced amount
converted from KRW to USD at the exchange rate of the payment date, no later than [***] days prior to the shipment date by way of wire transfer
to Dong-A. NeuroBo shall be responsible for and pay all wire transfer fees incurred in the Territory. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for the first three shipments, NeuroBo shall pay the invoiced amount within 60 days after the invoice date. If Dong-A does not receive payment of any
sum due to it on or before the due date, [***] interest shall thereafter accrue on the sum due to until the date of payment at the [***] rate of [***]
percent ([***]%) over the then-current prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York, New York or the maximum rate allowable by New York law,
whichever is lower.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. The original clause specifies payment is due [***] days prior to the shipment date. The added sentence states that for the first three shipments, payment is due 60 days after the invoice date. This ambiguity creates uncertainty about which payment term applies to the initial shipments.

perturbation.original_text:
5.6 The termination or expiration of this Agreement, in whole or in part, shall be without prejudice to the right of either Dong-A and NeuroBo
to receive all payments accrued and unpaid at the effective date of such termination or expiration, without prejudice to the remedy of either Dong-A
and NeuroBo in respect to any previous breach of any of the representations, warranties, covenants or obligations herein contained and without
prejudice to any other provisions hereof which expressly or necessarily call for performance after such termination or expiration.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.6 The termination or expiration of this Agreement, in whole or in part, shall be without prejudice to the right of either Dong-A and NeuroBo
to receive all payments accrued and unpaid at the effective date of such termination or expiration, without prejudice to the remedy of either Dong-A
and NeuroBo in respect to any previous breach of any of the representations, warranties, covenants or obligations herein contained and without
prejudice to any other provisions hereof which expressly or necessarily call for performance after such termination or expiration. However, upon termination by NeuroBo due to Dong-A's material breach, NeuroBo is not obligated to pay any outstanding invoices issued within 30 days prior to the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that termination does not affect the right to receive all accrued and unpaid payments. The added sentence says that if NeuroBo terminates due to Dong-A's material breach, NeuroBo does *not* have to pay invoices issued within 30 days prior to termination. This creates a direct contradiction regarding payment obligations upon termination under specific circumstances.
